user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_mkfs:
```c
int32 OS_mkfs(char *address, const char *devname, const char *volname, size_t blocksize, osal_blockcount_t numblocks)
{
    int32 return_code;

    return_code = OS_FileSys_Initialize(address, devname, volname, blocksize, numblocks, true);

    if (return_code == OS_ERR_INCORRECT_OBJ_STATE || return_code == OS_ERR_NO_FREE_IDS)
    {
        /*
         * This is the historic filesystem-specific error code generated when
         * attempting to mkfs()/initfs() on a filesystem that was
         * already initialized, or if there were no free slots in the table.
         *
         * This code preserved just in case application code was checking for it.
         */
        return_code = OS_FS_ERR_DEVICE_NOT_FREE;
    }

    return return_code;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: I inspected the entire function for use of compiler-specific language extensions (for example GCC/Clang __attribute__/__builtin__/__typeof__, inline asm, nested functions, statement-expressions ({ ... }), transparent unions, compiler-specific storage-class specifiers, or other documented compiler extensions). None of those constructs appear in this code fragment. The identifiers int32 and osal_blockcount_t are custom typedef names (not language extensions) and may be project-defined types; their use is a normal typedef usage rather than a compiler extension. size_t and string pointer types are standard C. The boolean token true is the standard boolean macro from <stdbool.h> (its presence here is not a language extension). The conditional, return, and comment constructs are all standard C. Therefore there are no explicit compiler language extensions in this snippet to flag for MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2.
